metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1938 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
python-rply before 0.7.4 insecurely creates temporary files.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1938` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pypy-rply - 0.7.4-1
python-rply - 0.7.4-1
python3-rply - 0.7.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-rply package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.7.4-1').
